words.definition: To acquire something is to gain possession of it.
words.example: Tina acquired a strange package yesterday.

words.definition: If something is awkward, it is embarrassing and uncomfortable.
words.example: After dropping his coffee cup, Robbie felt awkward.

words.definition: A caretaker is a person who takes care of very young, old, or sick people.
words.example: My grandmother’s caretaker helps her get around the house.

words.definition: To deceive someone is to make them believe something that is not true.
words.example: He tried to deceive his friends as they were playing a game.

words.definition: To discourage someone is to make them feel less confident.
words.example: Mr. Perry discouraged the students from quitting school.

words.definition: If something is fake, it is made to look real in order to trick people.
words.example: The image of the ghost was obviously fake.

words.definition: Hatred is a strong feeling of not liking someone or something.
words.example: I have a lot of hatred for people who mistreat animals.

words.definition: A hut is a small house made of wood, grass, or mud.
words.example: We all went into the hut to get out of the rain.

words.definition: If something is inferior, it is not as good as something else.
words.example: Cars built a hundred years ago are inferior to modern ones.

words.definition: A lodge is a house used by people who hunt or fish.
words.example: The log cabin was a great place for a lodge.

words.definition: To neglect someone or something is to not take care of them properly.
words.example: William neglected his health, so he got sick.

words.definition: A newcomer is a person who has recently arrived at a place.
words.example: The students welcomed the newcomer to the school.

words.definition: An offense is behavior that is wrong or breaks a law.
words.example: Stealing a car is a very serious offense.

words.definition: To overlook something is to not notice it or to not realize how important it is.
words.example: He overlooked the mistake he had made.

words.definition: To repay is to pay back or to reward someone or something.
words.example: She repaid her friend for all of his help.

words.definition: If something is ridiculous, it is silly or strange.
words.example: Steve looked ridiculous in those oversized clothes.

words.definition: If something is satisfactory, it is good enough.
words.example: Mina’s performance was satisfactory but not amazing.

words.definition: A shepherd is a person who looks after sheep.
words.example: The shepherd moved the sheep to another field.

words.definition: To venture is to go to a place that may be dangerous.
words.example: Even though it was dark, we ventured into the forest.

words.definition: Wheat is a plant which is used to make flour for bread.
words.example: The field of golden wheat looked beautiful.
